definition:
If $(\sigma, \delta)$ is a skew derivation on a ring $R$, then a
[*$(\sigma, \delta)$-constant*]{} is an element $q$ of $R$ such that
$\sigma(q)=q$ and $\delta(q)=0$.

Note: If $q$ is a $(\sigma, \delta)$-constant, then it follows that
$\sigma(q \cdot x)=q \cdot \sigma(x)$ and
$\delta(q \cdot x)=q \cdot \delta(x)$ for all $x$ in $R$.
